metadata.title: CVE-2023-23002 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.16.3, drivers/bluetooth/hci_qca.cmisinterprets the devm_gpiod_get_index_optional return value (expects it tobe NULL in the error case, whereas it is actually an error pointer).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23002` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-21.21').
